title: Azure-Functions crash when X-Forwarded headers are enabled java.lang.NullPointerException
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm trying to deploy a quarkus application to azure functions behind a proxy.

After I added those two properties `quarkus.http.proxy.proxy-address-forwarding=true` and `quarkus.http.proxy.enable-forwarded-host=true` the application started to crash whenever it receives a request.


### Expected behavior

The application should not crash. It should take into account X-Forwarded headers when it receives them by creating absolute urls with values provided in the headers. Additionally, it should still work if those headers are not provided in the request.

### Actual behavior

Quarkus crashes after receiving a request when the application is deployed to azure functions with those parameters enabled:
quarkus.http.proxy.proxy-address-forwarding=true
quarkus.http.proxy.enable-forwarded-host=true

It doesn't seem to matter if the X-Forwarded headers are part of the request or not.

### How to Reproduce?

1. create a simple quarkus application with QuarkusResteasyReactive dependency
2. enable azure-functions support by adding those properties
```
quarkus.http.root-path=/api
quarkus.http.port=${FUNCTIONS_HTTPWORKER_PORT}
```
and this dependency
```
quarkus-azure-functions-http
```
3. build the application `quarkus build`
4. zip content of the target/azure-function directory
5. create azure function in the azure cloud
6. deploy the zip file with `az functionapp deployment source config-zip -g your_resource_group -n your-azure-application-name --src ./your-zip-file.zip`
7. open the log stream at azure
8. send a request
